chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Anthony Liberty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample, if not previously done & pay surcharge.

Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol, illegal drugs, controlled substances or prescription medications without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.
No contact with K.W., C.D. and J.S.
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, except restaurants and grocery stores.

AODA & follow through and any other counseling as determined by the agent.
If available with probation in Indiana; defendant to make 1 public presentation per month (as worked out with and approved by agent) regarding his journey/experience.

Court imposes:  Imposed & Stayed 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision.  No credit.  Def is not eligible for SAP or CIP.  3 years probation.  Consecutive to existing sentence. 
Conditions:  May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.  No firearms or body armor. Provide DNA sample, if not previously done & pay surcharge.
